title: Is it considered solipsism if you think you are the only conscious person? - Quora

response.answer_text: sol·ip·sism /sälipˌsizəm/ nounThe view or theory that the self is all that can be known to exist.  If someone contends they have knowledge of things existing outside of their own mind, such as non-conscious "people", the cars the non-conscious entities are driving, the hamburgers the non-conscious entities are eating, etc., then this worldview is not solipsism.  If humanoid entities are going about their lives, yet seem to be non-conscious, then perhaps you recently moved to Stepford, Connecticut or Uncanny Valley.  Otherwise, maybe your neighborhood is suffering from a plague of philosophical zombies. Is your water fluoridated?
